subject: The Return of the Phipps
event: If the old gods, the new gods, and American Airlines all cooperate, Parris should be returning to Santa Fe this evening.  Hoorah!  I hear she had a great time in Ireland, but she's been sorely missed on this side of the water.

comments.article:
Aww.
Hope she bought me a postcard back. =P

I won't worry about the gods (if nothing else you can bribe them with a freshly slaughtered bull), but the American Airlines.

Good luck for her safe return.

comments.upictitle: маленький цЫфровой ревербератор Michael Lyahovich: баран
comments.article: wish you luck
Especially with all the stuff going on over in UK, I wish her even more luck with getting back home without losing her sanity.

Gwen came home safe to me today.  She came back from Ireland via a driving tour through England and a flight to Montreal through Heathrow.  She phoned me to make me know she was safe despite all that stuff.  So it is possible to survive!  If Parris is flying directly from Ireland, the stuff in England shouldn't affect her trip much.
I hope she has a good flight home! :]
Good news, indeed.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cocktail
comments.article: *fingers crossed* that all will be smooth -- we'll drink a toast to appease the Gods of Travel. You may wish to fix up the garden hose to shower the front walk while she arrives -- after hearing about the torrential downpours, I fear she'll be disoriented with the NM aridity. ;-)

yay for you! I wish her a safe voyage!!! =D
once she's home, you won't be so lonely anymore.
It's so cute to hear a guy all happy and excited about his girl coming home.
comments.subject: Awwww

comments.article: Safe travels to your lady love. I am so glad to hear that she had a good time in Ireland. Sounds like a great place to visit. Especially if seeing good friends is on the itinerary. :)

I don't mean to interrupt you or your writing but if we can't get a ADWD update, can we at least get HBO update? Is it possible that maybe you could get Mr. Benioff or Mr. Weiss to post something on here? Is the series even a definite yet? I know that in Hollywood nothing is definite & that when a company like HBO options it doesn't really mean something WILL be made. What it means is that for now nobody BUT HBO can make ASoIaF. If Weiss & Benioff do still intend to charge ahead on this do they at least have a projected season? 2009? 2010? Have they contacted Peter Dinklage yet? Is he available? Just anxious here.
comments.subject: On an older note........

comments.article: I think you're a little too stressed out. I'm sure news will pop up as it comes along.
comments.subject: Re: On an older note........

comments.article:
Hopefully there won't be a problem - here in Scotland it's only really the Glasgow flights that are badly affected.

Sounds though like she's had a great time from her updates. And you'll get to here ALL about them when she gets back I'm sure :)
I'm sorry, but American Airlines is not affiliated with God.  Judging from our last two trips with them, they are affiliated with Hell, unless, of course, they've had a recent managerial change.
Great! Hope she has a smooth flight home. :D

Wow, I can actually relate to this. My fiancee is in England right now and I miss him like crazy. Trying to plan an impossible intercontinantal wedding in the meantime...

Have a great time when she returns :) and hope all is well with you.

And you guys who just can't stop pestering George about writing need to lay off a bit and let him be just a man for a minute. Light! His life doesn't exist completly for your pleasure. Honestly, some people.
Hope she got home safe and sound!
Yay! I hope her flight home isn't too traumatic!
I hope you have a great couple of days together and have a good con weekend. :)

on my iPod!

There's an interview with you featured as a free download this week.
comments.subject: I've Got You!

comments.article: If the old gods, new gods, or ANY GODS cooperate you will finish these books before i become an old old man!!  J/K  :)
comments.subject: The Return

comments.article:
You cannot rush the creative process. Leave him be!

Looking forward to INCON this weekend. Woohoo! See you there George :)
comments.subject: Leave George Alone!

comments.article: I'll see you there! I'll be dressed in my original costume of blue tshirt and jeans, but my defining mark will be the bottle openers under my feet.
comments.subject: Re: Leave George Alone!

comments.article:
Ask her did she enjoy the virtually ridiculous weather we have been receiving for the past two months - I know my country is a glistening wet emerald on a natural day, but even we are a touch shocked by this tumultuous soaking torrent. I suspect she may have enjoyed her time in-doors for much of her stay.

Keith, Dublin.
comments.subject: A Wet Affair

comments.article:
I am quite glad for you that she is coming back and well, she should be back by now... darn, well I hope she had a safe trip.

I know that you must get off subject replies all of the time, but I don't know how else to ask you. I apologize if this seems rude or is quite annoying. I just got wind of the HBO realization of the A Song of Ice and Fire series which is very exciting. I am a seventeen year old actor and was wondering if there was anything you could tell me that might help me get a part (however small or insignificant) in the series. I am willing to anything and everything in my power to be a part of what will surely be an amazing project. My email is 'hisorpheus@gmail.com'. I don't know if you will reply to this, but thank you anyways for reading this and being such an all around wonderful writer and person.

-Kelley, SF NM, or Crozet, VA

Here's hoping Parris a safe trip home.
I'll also be seeing you at InCon, I can't wait! In fact, you're probably traveling up here right now. So, here's hoping you have a safe trip too!
Does anyone here know George`s email address? :) I`d be very grateful if someone could tell me.

I'm more the technology writer type (http://www.pocketnow.com, http://www.geardiary.com and http://www.wugnet.com), and have been professionally writing in that arena for about 11 years. However, I know how having a loved-one away can effect the creative juices. I'm glad that Parris (sp?? didn't mean to blow it...) is back and hope she had a wonderful trip.

I am a HUGE fan of Fire and Ice, and am waiting with a worm on my tongue (baited breath) for Dance to get finished. I must admit that I read thru Feast much too quickly. I may just have to go back and start the series over again while waiting for Dance to finish...

If you ever have computer or PDA problems of any type, please feel free to give me a shout. I'd be happy to help out in any way I can.

Wishing you gobs of creative productivity...


Christopher Spera
comments.subject: Glad you're not so lonely
